org.dblock.log4jna.nt

Class Win32EventLogAppender

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.logging.log4j.core.AbstractLifeCycle
      • org.apache.logging.log4j.core.filter.AbstractFilterable
        • org.apache.logging.log4j.core.appender.AbstractAppender
          • org.dblock.log4jna.nt.Win32EventLogAppender
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.apache.logging.log4j.core.Appender, org.apache.logging.log4j.core.filter.Filterable, org.apache.logging.log4j.core.impl.LocationAware, org.apache.logging.log4j.core.LifeCycle, org.apache.logging.log4j.core.LifeCycle2

    @Plugin(name="Win32EventLog",
        category="Core",
        elementType="appender",
        printObject=true)
public class Win32EventLogAppender
extends org.apache.logging.log4j.core.appender.AbstractAppender
    Append to the NT event log system.

    WARNING This appender can only be installed and used on a Windows system.

    Do not forget to place jna.jar and platform.jar in the CLASSPATH.

    Author:
    Chris Taylor, Jim Cakalic, Daniel Doubrovkine, Tony Niemira, Claudio Trajtenberg, yokra

      • requiresLayout

        public boolean requiresLayout()
        The Win32EventLogAppender requires a layout. Hence, this method always returns true.

      • getEventLogType

        private static int getEventLogType(org.apache.logging.log4j.Level level)
        Convert log4j Priority to an EventLog type. The log4j package supports 8 defined priorities, but the NT EventLog only knows 3 event types of interest to us: ERROR, WARNING, and INFO.
        Parameters:
        level - Log4j priority.
        Returns:
        EventLog type.

      • getEventLogCategory

        private static int getEventLogCategory(org.apache.logging.log4j.Level level)
        Convert log4j Priority to an EventLog category. Each category is backed by a message resource so that proper category names will be displayed in the NT Event Viewer.
        Parameters:
        level - Log4J priority.
        Returns:
        EventLog category.
